Detailed Description

vtkVisualizationModel object defines a visualization mesh (vtkPolyData)

This class inherits from vtkModel base class. As it is specified in vtkModel, at least an input mesh should be defined. Optionally a source mesh for synchronization purposes may be defined. To enhance visualization user experience a mesh texture can be specified through the TextureFileName attribute.

void vtkVisualizationModel::Init ( ) [virtual]

Abstract initialization function.

This method initializes the tool physical values, scale, position, etc...

Reimplemented from vtkModel.

bool vtkModel::IsDisabled ( ) [inline, inherited]

Check if model is disabled.

When an model is disabled it will NOT:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection.
  • be used in simulation.
bool vtkModel::IsHidden ( ) [inline, inherited]

Check if model is hidden.

When an model is disabled it will NOT:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection. It will be used in simulation.
bool vtkModel::IsVisible ( ) [inline, inherited]

Check if model is visible.

When an model is disabled it will:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection.
  • be used in simulation.

void vtkModel::SetSource ( vtkPolyData *  source) [virtual, inherited]

Specify the source object for mesh synchronization purposes.

This is an optional input. If source is set, the model primary mesh will be synchronized to this source mesh whenever a change is made on it.

See also:
vtkPolyData* GetSource()
